P47: countries or administrative subdivisions, of equal level, that this item borders, either by land or water. A single common point is enough.

P4387: method used by an app/OS to receive updates or self-update
P40: subject has object as biological, foster, and/or adoptive child
P413: position or specialism of a player on a team, e.g. Small Forward
P1455: link to the article with the works of a person
P410: military rank achieved by a person (should usually have a "start time" qualifier), or military rank associated with a position
P417: patron saint adopted by the subject
P415: describes the overall content broadcast on a radio station
P1441: this (fictional) entity or person is present in the story of that work (use P2860 for works citing other works, P361/P1433 for works being part of / published in other works, P1343 for entities described in non-fictional accounts)
P822: mascot of an organization, e.g. a sports team or university

equivalent name (with respect to the meaning of the name) in the same language: female version of a male first name, male version of a female first name. Add primarily the closest matching one
P1290: person who is the godparent of a given person
P825: person or organization to whom the subject was dedicated
P1456: link to the list of heritage monuments in the place/area
P1956: type of takeoff and landing the aircraft is designed to operate
P553: website that the person or organization has an account on (use with P554) Note: only used with reliable source or if the person or organization disclosed it.

classification of colleges and universities in the United States

P556: type of crystal for minerals and/or for crystal compounds

P1595: offence with which someone is charged, at a trial

P1593: person representing the defendant, at a trial

P598: for persons who are notable as commanding officers, the units they commanded
P816: what isotope does this radioactive isotope decay to
P1840: person or organization involved in investigation of the item
P4132: classification of languages according to their linguistic trait (as opposed to historical families like romance languages)

P736: name of person or team creating cover artwork for album, single, book, etc.
P112: founder or co-founder of this organization, religion or place
P1365: person or item replaced. Use "structure replaces" (P1398) for structures. Use "follows" (P155) if the previous item was not replaced or predecessor and successor are identical
P735: first name or another given name of this person; values used with the property shouldn't link disambiguations nor family names.
P1363: person who scored a point or goal in a game

P3095: type of agents that study this subject or work in this profession
P3094: this class of items develops from another class of items

P739: cartridge or other ammunition used by the subject firearm

P2869: links to item on the record or record progression
P306: operating system (OS) on which a software works or the OS installed on hardware

P1201: spacecraft vehicle designed to move the payload from a reference orbit to the target orbit, or direct it to an interplanetary trajectory
P1202: scientific instruments carried by a vessel, satellite, or device that are not required for propelling or navigating
